ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Controlling real-world robots and drones using Large Language Models (LLMs) through a command-line interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Command-line interface for LLMs to control robots and drones â€¢ Written in Bash using Osprey â€¢ Supports multi-step interactions with models like Qwen 2.5 â€¢ Uses MCP (Model Context Protocol) for communication with robots â€¢ Can run locally or with remote services (Docker Model Runner)
ðŸ“– Summary: Skynet is a command-line tool that allows LLMs to control robots and drones using Bash and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It facilitates multi-step interactions with models like Qwen 2.5 and can be run locally or with remote services like Docker Model Runner, enabling AI-driven control of physical devices.
